page.title: 18THE ANNUAL GUN RUN
page.content: THE GUN RUN IS HELD EVERY YEAR, IN JUNE. THIS IS WHEN TEAMS OF SOLDIERS PULL A 25 POUNDER GUN. THERE ARE ABOUT 16 SOLDIERS ON EACH. THERE ARE ALSO CADETS AND JUNIOR SOLDIERS,WHO TAKE PART IN THE CONTEST.THE ROUTE OF THE GUN RUN STARTS AT AN ARMY TRANSIT CAMP CALED WESTDOWN, NEAR TILSHEAD. THE GUN RUN IS ALL ACROSS LARKHILL RANGE ROADS.THERE ARE SEVERAL CHECK POINTS THE TEAMS HAVE TO GO THROUGH. AT EACH OF THESE THEY MAKE SURE THE TEAMS HAVE NOT CHANGED ANY MEN AND SO THE COMMENTATOR CAN GIVE A ROUGH GUIDE AS TO HOW LONG THE TEAM HAVE TAKEN TO COMPLETE THAT STAGE. VARIOUS BACK-UP TEAMS GIVE WATER OR ORANGES TO THE MEN PULLING THEIR GUNS. THE FINISH OF THE GUN RUN IS AT THE OFFICERS MESS AT THE SCHOOL OF ARTILLERY, WHERE THERE'S A FETE FOR THE ARMY FAMILIES.
